    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static final FileKeyStore create​(java.io.File file,
                                        Password password)
                                 throws KeyStoreLtException
        Constructs a new object with a new KeyStore created, the password will be used when persist keystore to protects its integrity.

        If a password is not given for integrity, then integrity checking is not performed.
        Parameters:
        file - keystore
        password - the password used to check the integrity of the keystore, the password used to unlock the keystore, or null
        Returns:
        a new DefaultKeyStore
        Throws:
        KeyStoreLtException -
        +Cause KeyStoreException if a KeyStoreSpi implementation for the specified type is not available from the specified provider
        +Cause NoSuchProviderException if the specified provider is not registered in the security provider list
        +Cause NoSuchAlgorithmException if the algorithm used to check the integrity of the keystore cannot be found

      • load

        public static final FileKeyStore load​(java.io.File file,
                                      Password password)
                               throws KeyStoreLtException,
                                      java.io.IOException
        Constructs a new object with a new KeyStore loaded from the given filename argument.

        A password may be given to unlock the keystore (e.g. the keystore resides on a hardware token device), or to check the integrity of the keystore data. If a password is not given for integrity checking, then integrity checking is not performed.
        Parameters:
        file - keystore
        password - the password used to check the integrity of the keystore, the password used to unlock the keystore, or null
        Returns:
        a new DefaultKeyStore
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is an I/O or format problem with the keystore data, if a password is required but not given, or if the given password was incorrect. If the error is due to a wrong password, the cause of the IOException should be an UnrecoverableKeyException
        KeyStoreLtException -
        +Cause KeyStoreException if a KeyStoreSpi implementation for the specified type is not available from the specified provider
        +Cause NoSuchProviderException if the specified provider is not registered in the security provider list
        +Cause NoSuchAlgorithmException if the algorithm used to check the integrity of the keystore cannot be found
        +Cause CertificateException if any of the certificates in the keystore could not be loaded

      • persist

        public final void persist()
                   throws KeyStoreLtException,
                          java.io.IOException
        Stores the keystore, and protects its integrity with the given password
        Throws:
        KeyStoreLtException -
        +Cause NoSuchAlgorithmException if the appropriate data integrity algorithm could not be found
        +Cause CertificateException if any of the certificates included in the keystore data could not be stored
        java.io.IOException - If there was an I/O problem with data

                                    java.io.IOException,
                                    CertificateLtException
        Throws:

      • containsAlias

        public final boolean containsAlias​(java.lang.String alias)
        Checks if the given alias exists in this keystore.
        Parameters:
        alias - the alias name
        Returns:
        true if the alias exists, false otherwise

      • getKeyCertificate

        public final org.bouncycastle.cert.X509CertificateHolder getKeyCertificate​(java.lang.String alias)
                                                                    throws CertificateLtException
        Returns the first element of the key certificate chain associated with the given alias.
        Parameters:
        alias - the alias name
        Returns:
        the certificate, or null if the given alias does not exist or does not contain a certificate
        Throws:
        CertificateLtException -
        +Cause CertificateEncodingException if an encoding error occurs
        +Cause IOException in the event of corrupted data, or an incorrect structure

      • getTrustedCertificate

        public final org.bouncycastle.cert.X509CertificateHolder getTrustedCertificate​(java.lang.String alias)
                                                                        throws CertificateLtException
        Returns the trusted certificate associated with the given alias.
        Parameters:
        alias - the alias name
        Returns:
        the certificate, or null if the given alias does not exist or does not contain a certificate
        Throws:
        CertificateLtException -
        +Cause CertificateEncodingException if an encoding error occurs
        +Cause IOException in the event of corrupted data, or an incorrect structure

      • getKeyCertificateChain

        public final org.bouncycastle.cert.X509CertificateHolder[] getKeyCertificateChain​(java.lang.String alias)
                                                                           throws CertificateLtException
        Returns the certificate chain associated with the given alias. The certificate chain must have been associated with the alias by a call to setPrivateKeyEntry.
        Parameters:
        alias - the alias name
        Returns:
        the certificate chain (ordered with the user's certificate first and the root certificate authority last), or null if the given alias does not exist or does not contain a certificate chain
        Throws:
        CertificateLtException
        CertificateLtException -
        +Cause CertificateEncodingException if an encoding error occurs
        +Cause IOException in the event of corrupted data, or an incorrect structure

      • isTrustedCertificateEntry

        public final boolean isTrustedCertificateEntry​(java.lang.String alias)
        Returns true if the entry identified by the given alias was created by a call to setTrustedCertificateEntry.
        Parameters:
        alias - the alias for the keystore entry to be checked
        Returns:
        true if the entry identified by the given alias contains a trusted certificate, false otherwise

      • isKeyEntry

        public final boolean isKeyEntry​(java.lang.String alias)
        Returns true if the entry identified by the given alias was created by a call to setPrivateKeyEntry, or created by a call to setSecretKeyEntry.
        Parameters:
        alias - the alias for the keystore entry to be checked
        Returns:
        true if the entry identified by the given alias is a key-related entry, false otherwise

      • setTrustedCertificateEntry

        public final void setTrustedCertificateEntry​(java.lang.String alias,
                                             org.bouncycastle.cert.X509CertificateHolder cert)
                                      throws KeyStoreLtException,
                                             CertificateLtException
        Assigns the given trusted certificate to the given alias.

        If the given alias identifies an existing entry created by a call to setTrustedCertificateEntry, the trusted certificate in the existing entry is overridden by the given certificate.
        Parameters:
        alias - the alias name
        cert - the certificate
        Throws:
        KeyStoreLtException -
        +Cause KeyStoreException if the given alias already exists and does not identify an entry containing a trusted certificate, or this operation fails for some other reason
        CertificateLtException -
        +Cause CertificateException if the conversion is unable to be made
